name: legend

sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

name: anthropologist

sentences.chinese: 这是我作为一名人类学家所理解的----人们喜欢讲述自己的故事。

sentences.english: Fisher, a biological anthropologist, says she wrote her latest book because she wanted to uncover the science behind “why you love who you love and perhaps even help people find the one”.
sentences.chinese: 费舍尔，生物人类学家，说她的最新著作的出发点是缘于她想揭开“为什么你会爱上你的爱人，这也许会帮助人们找到爱人”背后的科学依据。

sentences.english: A data manager, media coordinator, and medical anthropologist will also be arriving over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 一名数据管理员、媒体协调员和医学人类学家也将于周末抵达。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

sentences.chinese: 效忠首领是波利尼西亚人最基本的文化。

sentences.english: It is possible that Polynesian rats, arriving with human settlers, may have eaten enough seeds to help to decimate the trees.

sentences.english: Polynesian society blossomed in this unlikely locale after hardy souls somehow navigated a fleet of wooden outrigger canoes to this tiny speck in the vastness of the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 在一群勇敢的人们驾驶着一队独木舟来到广阔的太平洋上的这个小岛上，一个波利尼西亚社会开始在这个不可思议的位置繁荣了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 波利尼西亚人, 波利尼西亚语
detailed_translations.english: a member of the people that inhabit Polynesia, generally of Caucasoid features with light skin and wavy hair

sentences.chinese: 我们可用印尼亚齐省这一范例指导我们的工作。

sentences.english: In Indonesia she finds yet another piece of herself: the balance between the pleasures of eating and praying.
sentences.chinese: 在印度尼西亚，她又找到了另一份自我：在吃的乐趣与祈祷的乐趣之间的平衡。

sentences.chinese: 其实她是一个考古学家。

sentences.english: But I do not believe, as a field archaeologist, that we can use the scientific method to prove or disprove [them].
sentences.chinese: 但作为一个在现场工作的考古学家，我不相信我们能用科学手段对它们进行证实或证伪”。

name: flint

sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

name: physiological
trans: adj. 生理学的，生理的

sentences.english: If so, this would add to a growing list of physiological and biological markers of sexual orientation.
sentences.chinese: 如果是这样，这可能会给生理和生物学上的性取向标记增加一长串名单。

sentences.english: While this loss of stature is attributed partially to shrinking bones and the other physiological effects of aging, some researchers say this is no coincidence at all.
sentences.chinese: 虽然身高减少的部分原因是衰老所产生的骨骼收缩以及其他生理现象，但一些研究人员说这绝非巧合。

name: maximum
trans: n. [数] 极大，最大限度；最大量
adj. 最高的；最多的；最大极限的

sentences.english: The car has a maximum speed of 120 mph.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车的最高时速为120英里。

sentences.english: They made maximum use of the resources available.
sentences.chinese: 他们充分利用可获取的资源。

sentences.english: To get the maximum benefit, do the exercises slowly.
sentences.chinese: 要想获得最佳的效果，这些运动要做得慢一点。

sentences.english: Display the hologram under a strong light for maximum effect.
sentences.chinese: 把立体全息图放在强光下展示以得到最佳效果。

sentences.english: The plant is operating at maximum capacity .
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂正在开足马力生产。

sentences.english: The award will consist of a lump sum to a maximum value of $5,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖学金最高将是5,000美元，一次性给付。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最大的； 最高的； 顶点的
detailed_translations.english: the maximum amount, quantity, speed etc is the largest that is possible or allowed
the largest number or amount that is possible or is allowed

name: consideration
trans: n. 考虑；原因；关心；报酬

sentences.english: proposals put forward for consideration
sentences.chinese: 提请考虑的建议

sentences.english: They’ve got no consideration for others.
sentences.chinese: 他们一点都不为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: careful thought and attention, especially before making an official or important decision

name: descendant
trans: n. 后裔；子孙
adj. 下降的；祖传的

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: artificial
trans: adj. 人造的；仿造的；虚伪的；非原产地的；武断的

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: impose
trans: vt. 强加；征税；以…欺骗
vi. 利用；欺骗；施加影响

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: dimension
trans: n. 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt. 标出尺寸
adj. 规格的

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: skyscraper
trans: n. 摩天楼，超高层大楼；特别高的东西

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a top needle of a skyscraper is pressing toward him. He fails to dodge and bumps heavily on the concrete needle.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一座摩天大厦的尖型顶柱朝他逼来，他躲避不及，重重地撞在混凝土顶柱上。

detailed_translations.english: a very tall modern city building

name: tenant
trans: n. 承租人；房客；佃户；居住者
vt. 租借（常用于被动语态）

sentences.english: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
sentences.chinese: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it

name: civilized
trans: adj. 文明的；有礼貌的
v. 教化；使…文明；启发（civilize的过去分词）

sentences.english: Such things should not happen in a civilized society.
sentences.chinese: 文明社会不应该有这种事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: a civilized society is well organized and developed, and has fair laws and customs

name: banal
trans: adj. 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的

sentences.english: conversations about the most banal subjects
sentences.chinese: 最无聊的谈话

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting, because of a lack of new or different ideas

name: luxury
trans: n. 奢侈，奢华；奢侈品；享受
adj. 奢侈的

sentences.english: He was leading a life of luxury in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚过着豪华舒适的生活。

sentences.english: The dress is lambswool – pure luxury.
sentences.chinese: 礼服是用羔羊毛制作的——绝对奢华。

sentences.english: luxuries like chocolate and perfume
sentences.chinese: 巧克力、香水之类的奢侈品

detailed_translations.english: very great comfort and pleasure, such as you get from expensive food, beautiful houses, cars etc

name: deprive
trans: vt. 使丧失，剥夺

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: monstrous
trans: adj. 巨大的；怪异的；荒谬的；畸形的

sentences.english: a monstrous nose
sentences.chinese: 很大的鼻子

sentences.english: a monstrous shadow on the stairs
sentences.chinese: 楼梯上一个可怕的影子

detailed_translations.english: unusually large

name: edifice
trans: n. 大厦；大建筑物

sentences.english: Their head office was an imposing edifice.
sentences.chinese: 他们的总部大楼是一幢宏伟建筑。

detailed_translations.english: a building, especially a large one

name: toxic
trans: adj. 有毒的；中毒的

sentences.english: fumes from a toxic waste dump
sentences.chinese: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

sentences.english: a highly toxic pesticide
sentences.chinese: 毒性很强的杀虫剂

detailed_translations.english: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

name: ceaselessly
trans: adv. 不停地

name: throng
trans: n. 人群；众多
vt. 群集；挤满
vi. 蜂拥而至；群集
adj. 拥挤的

sentences.english: She got lost in the throng.
sentences.chinese: 她在人群中迷路了。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people in one place
if people throng a place, they go there in large numbers

name: settlement
trans: n. 解决，处理；[会计] 结算；沉降；殖民

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: enterprising
trans: adj. 有事业心的；有进取心的；有魄力的；有胆量的

sentences.english: Some enterprising students are designing software.
sentences.chinese: 一些有创业精神的学生在设计软件。

sentences.english: an enterprising scheme to provide interest-free loans
sentences.chinese: 一项提供无息贷款的创业计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 有事业心的, 有进取心的
detailed_translations.english: having the ability to think of new activities or ideas and make them work

name: settler
trans: n. 移居者；殖民者

sentences.english: early settlers in Australia
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚的早期移民

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in a country or area where not many people like them have lived before, and that is a long way from any towns or cities

name: Antipodes
trans: n. 地球上处于正相对应的两个地区，尤指（与欧洲形成对跖地的）澳大拉西亚

name: promiscuous
trans: adj. 混杂的；杂乱的
adv. 偶然地；胡乱地

sentences.english: the risks of promiscuous sexual behaviour
sentences.chinese: 不检点性行为的危险

detailed_translations.english: having many sexual partners

name: abandon
trans: n. 放任；狂热
vt. 遗弃；放弃

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: overrun
trans: n. 泛滥成灾；超出限度
vt. 泛滥；超过；蹂躏
vi. 泛滥；蔓延

sentences.english: cost overruns of £2 billion
sentences.chinese: 20亿英镑的超额费用

detailed_translations.english: Overrun is also a noun
if unwanted things or people overrun a place, they spread over it in great numbers

name: devastation
trans: n. 毁坏，荒废

sentences.english: The war brought massive devastation and loss of life to the region.
sentences.chinese: 战争给该地区造成巨大的破坏以及生命的丧失。

detailed_translations.english: Devastation is severe and widespread destruction or damage

name: burrow
trans: n. （兔、狐等的）洞穴，地道；藏身处，住处
vt. 挖掘，挖出；在…挖洞（或通道）；使躲入洞穴
vi. 探索，寻找；挖地洞，挖通道；住入地洞，躲藏起来；钻进某处；偎依著

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: susceptible
trans: n. 易得病的人
adj. 易受影响的；易感动的；容许…的

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: virus
trans: n. [病毒] 病毒；恶毒；毒害

sentences.english: children infected with the Aids virus
sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

sentences.english: a virus infection
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

name: myxomatosis
trans: n. 多发粘液瘤病；[肿瘤] 粘液瘤变性

name: infect
trans: vt. 感染，传染

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

name: epidemic
trans: n. 传染病；流行病；风尚等的流行
adj. 流行的；传染性的

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: mosquito
trans: n. 蚊子

sentences.english: The male mosquito never stings.
sentences.chinese: 雄蚊不叮。

sentences.english: Are your mosquito bites still itching?
sentences.chinese: 你被蚊子咬的地方还痒吗?

sentences.english: The frog darted out its tongue to catch a mosquito.
sentences.chinese: 这只青蛙突然伸出舌头捕捉蚊子。

detailed_translations.english: a small flying insect that sucks the blood of people and animals, sometimes spreading the disease  malaria

name: carrier
trans: n. [化学] 载体；运送者；带菌者；货架

sentences.english: a baby carrier
sentences.chinese: 婴儿背带

detailed_translations.english: something used for carrying something

name: exterminate
trans: vt. 消灭；根除

sentences.english: Staff use the poison to exterminate moles and rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 员工用毒药来消灭鼹鼠和野兔。

detailed_translations.english: to kill large numbers of people or animals of a particular type so that they no longer exist

name: ironically
trans: adv. 讽刺地；说反话地

sentences.english: Ironically, his cold got better on the last day of his holiday.
sentences.chinese: 具有讽刺意味的是，他的感冒竟在假期的最后一天有所好转。

detailed_translations.chinese: 具有讽刺意味地；嘲讽地
detailed_translations.english: used when talking about a situation in which the opposite of what you expected happens or is true

name: bequeath
trans: vt. 遗赠；把…遗赠给；把…传下去

sentences.english: He bequeathed all his silver to his children.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有的银币都留给了他的孩子们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗赠；把…遗赠给；把…传下去
detailed_translations.english: to officially arrange for someone to have something that you own after your death

name: pest
trans: n. 害虫；有害之物；讨厌的人

sentences.english: a chemical used in pest control
sentences.chinese: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

detailed_translations.chinese: 害虫；有害之物；讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

name: pestilence
trans: n. 瘟疫（尤指鼠疫）；有害的事物

sentences.english: There is the source of the recurring pestilence .
sentences.chinese: 那里是一再发生瘟疫的策源地。

sentences.english: They were crazed by the famine and pestilence of that bitter winter .
sentences.chinese: 他们被那年严冬的饥荒与瘟疫逼疯了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that spreads quickly and kills a lot of people

name: confine
trans: n. 界限，边界;约束；限制
vt. 限制；禁闭

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison
sentences.chinese: 在监狱范围内

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: domesticate
trans: vt. 驯养；教化；引进
vi. 驯养；使习惯于或喜爱家务和家庭生活

sentences.english: We domesticated the dog to help us with hunting.
sentences.chinese: 我们驯养狗来帮助我们打猎。

detailed_translations.english: to make an animal able to work for people or live with them as a pet

name: porpoise
trans: n. 海豚；鼠海豚

sentences.english: The rays are often seen gathering in groups near the surface, “flying” through the water by flapping their pectoral fins and sometimes even leaping porpoise-like into the air.
sentences.chinese: 魟鱼经常会成群的聚集在水面以下，通过拍动胸鳍在水中“飞行”，有时候甚至会像海豚一样跃出海面。

sentences.english: The Baiji Conservation Aquarium has already scored small successes with a similar breeding scheme aimed at averting the extinction of the endangered Yangtze finless porpoise.
sentences.chinese: 为防止这种无鳍海豚的灭绝，白鳍豚保护水族馆采用相同的培育方法已经取得了一些成就。

sentences.english: Still, she cautions that it's possible that the Dall's porpoise hunt in Japan may harm subpopulations of that animal, which numbers more than a million worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他警告在日本的捕猎可能危害白腰鼠海豚的亚种的安全，尽管白腰鼠海豚全种在地球上有一百多万只。

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal that looks similar to a  dolphin  and breathes air

name: mariner
trans: n. 水手；船员

sentences.english: A smooth sea never makes a skillful mariner.
sentences.chinese: 平静的大海造就不出熟练的水手。

detailed_translations.english: a  sailor

name: shark
trans: n. 鲨鱼；骗子
vt. 敲诈
vi. 诈骗

sentences.english: Sharks were circling around our boat.
sentences.chinese: 鲨鱼在我们的小船周围游弋。

sentences.english: Beware the sharks when you are making up your mind how to invest.
sentences.chinese: 当你决定如何投资时要提防诈骗者。

detailed_translations.english: a large sea fish with several rows of very sharp teeth that is considered to be dangerous to humans

name: formation
trans: n. 形成；构造；编队

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

name: dolphin
trans: n. 海豚

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: Daniel: Yes, like a dolphin.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔: 嗯，像海豚一样。

detailed_translations.english: a very intelligent sea animal like a fish with a long grey pointed nose

name: unconscious
trans: adj. 无意识的；失去知觉的；不省人事的；未发觉的

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

name: beaver
trans: n. 海狸；海狸皮毛

sentences.english: ...a coat with a huge beaver collar.
sentences.chinese: …一件带有大海狸毛皮领的大衣。

detailed_translations.english: a North American animal that has thick fur and a wide flat tail, and cuts down trees with its teeth

name: ashore
trans: adj. 在岸上的；在陆上的
adv. 在岸上；向岸

sentences.english: Several dead birds had been washed ashore.
sentences.chinese: 几只死鸟被冲上了岸。

detailed_translations.english: on or towards the shore of a lake, river, sea etc

name: waterlogged
trans: adj. 涝的；浸满水的，吸饱水的
v. 进水；浸满水（waterlog的过去分词）

name: scent
trans: n. 气味；嗅觉；痕迹；察觉能力
vt. 闻到；发觉；使充满…的气味；循着遗臭追踪
vi. 发出…的气味；有…的迹象；嗅着气味追赶

sentences.english: a yellow rose with a lovely scent
sentences.chinese: 香气怡人的黄玫瑰

detailed_translations.english: a pleasant smell that something has

name: ensue
trans: vi. 跟着发生，接着发生；继起
vt. 追求

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

name: intrigue

a strong push

trans: n. 滑水板

trans: n. 海洋水族馆

trans: n. 猛扑；俯冲；突然袭击

sentences.chinese: 鹰在天空盘旋，随时准备俯冲下来。

trans: n. 均衡；平静；保持平衡的能力

sentences.chinese: 宝宝软软的小屁股

sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

sentences.chinese: 他往平底锅里打了几个鸡蛋。

sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!

n. 奇数；怪人；奇特的事物

sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.

sentences.chinese: …一个小包裹，用薄棉纸包着。

sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

[医] 蝰的, 蝰

adj. 最高的；至高的；最重要的

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.english: When something is outlawed, it is made illegal

sentences.english: We need to carry out a proper evaluation of the new system.
sentences.chinese: 我们要对新系统进行合理的评估。

sentences.english: They took some samples of products for evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 他们抽取了一些产品样本以作评估。

detailed_translations.english: a judgment about how good, useful, or successful something is

name: infallibility
trans: n. 绝无错误；无过失

name: resent
trans: vt. 怨恨；愤恨；厌恶

sentences.english: Paul resented the fact that Carol didn’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

name: sincerity
trans: n. 真实，诚挚

sentences.english: I don’t doubt her sincerity, but I think she’s got her facts wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不怀疑她的诚意，但我认为她没弄清楚事实。

sentences.english: May I say in all sincerity that we could not have achieved this much without your help and support.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我真心诚意地说: 没有你们的帮助和支持，我们就不可能取得这样的成绩。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is sincere and really means what they are saying

name: victorian
trans: n. 维多利亚时代；维多利亚女王时代的人
adj. 维多利亚女王时代的；英国维多利亚女王时代的

name: retreat
trans: n. 撤退；休息寓所；撤退
vt. 退（棋）；使后退
vi. 撤退；退避；向后倾

sentences.english: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

detailed_translations.english: a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

name: unreasoning
trans: adj. 未加思量的；不合理的；无理性的；不讲理的

name: authoritarian
trans: n. 权力主义者；独裁主义者
adj. 独裁主义的；权力主义的

sentences.english: an authoritarian government
sentences.chinese: 独裁政府

sentences.english: Critics claim his management has become too authoritarian.
sentences.chinese: 批评者称他的管理变得过于专制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独裁主义的；权力主义的
detailed_translations.english: strictly forcing people to obey a set of rules or laws, especially ones that are wrong or unfair

detailed_translations.chinese: 权力主义者；独裁主义者

name: cow
trans: n. 奶牛，母牛；母兽
vt. 威胁，恐吓

sentences.english: Our cow is carrying again.
sentences.chinese: 我家的母牛又怀胎了。

sentences.english: The cow is expected to calve next week.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛预期下周生小牛。

sentences.english: The cow cast a calf.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛早产了。

detailed_translations.english: a large female animal that is kept on farms and used to produce milk or meat

name: hub
trans: n. 中心；毂；木片

sentences.english: the commercial hub of the region
sentences.chinese: 该地区的商业中心

detailed_translations.english: the central and most important part of an area, system, activity etc, which all the other parts are connected to

name: lunar
trans: adj. 月亮的，月球的；阴历的；银的；微亮的

sentences.english: studies of the lunar surface
sentences.chinese: 对月球表面的研究

sentences.english: a lunar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 月食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

name: oxygen
trans: n. [化学] 氧气，[化学] 氧

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

name: Apollo
trans: n. 阿波罗（太阳神）；美男子

name: accelerate
trans: vt. 使……加快；使……增速
vi. 加速；促进；增加

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

name: terrestrial
trans: n. 陆地生物；地球上的人
adj. 地球的；陆地的，[生物] 陆生的；人间的

sentences.english: ...terrestrial life forms.
sentences.chinese: …地球上的生命形态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地球的；陆地的，[生物] 陆生的；人间的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the Earth rather than to the moon or other  planets

name: permanently
trans: adv. 永久地，长期不变地

name: fascination
trans: n. 魅力；魔力；入迷

sentences.english: The fascination lay in the mystery of what was inside the box.
sentences.chinese: 吸引力就在于这神秘感——不知道盒子里是什么东西。

detailed_translations.english: something that interests you very much, or the quality of being very interesting

name: senior
trans: n. 上司；较年长者；毕业班学生
adj. 高级的；年长的；地位较高的；年资较深的，资格较老的

sentences.english: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
sentences.chinese: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

detailed_translations.english: a  senior citizen

name: chasm
trans: n. 峡谷；裂口；分歧；深坑

sentences.english: a rope bridge across the chasm
sentences.chinese: 峡谷上的索桥

detailed_translations.english: a very deep space between two areas of rock or ice, especially one that is dangerous

name: canyon
trans: n. 峡谷

sentences.english: The canyon is famous for producing echoes.
sentences.chinese: 这个峡谷以回声而闻名。

sentences.english: The grand canyon was not dug by the hand of man, but riven by nature.
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷并非人力所开而是受大自然之力而成的。

sentences.english: We made our way up the fixed rope and then down into a deeper third canyon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着固定的绳索前进，然后到达了一个更深的峡谷，这已经是第三个了。

detailed_translations.english: a deep valley with very steep sides of rock that usually has a river running through it

name: disunited
trans: adj. 分裂的；不和的
v. 使分离（disunite的过去式）

name: correspondingly
trans: adv. 相应地，相对地

sentences.english: As his political stature has shrunk, he has grown correspondingly more dependent on the army.
sentences.chinese: 随着政治声望不断降低，他相应地变得更依赖于军队了。

detailed_translations.english: You use correspondingly when describing a situation which is closely connected with one you have just mentioned or is similar to it

name: backward
trans: adj. 向后的；反向的；发展迟缓的
adv. 向后地；相反地

sentences.english: She went without a backward glance.
sentences.chinese: 她头也不回地走了。

sentences.english: He works backward, building a house from the top downward.
sentences.chinese: 他倒着干活，从上往下盖房子。

detailed_translations.english: looking or facing in the direction that is behind you
If you do something backward, you do it in the opposite way to the usual way

name: incur
trans: vt. 招致，引发；蒙受

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: administer
trans: vt. 管理；执行；给予
vi. 给予帮助；执行遗产管理人的职责；担当管理人

sentences.english: The money will be administered by local charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将由当地慈善机构管理。

sentences.english: Our office administers the affairs of the Society.
sentences.chinese: 我们办公室管理协会的事务。

detailed_translations.english: to manage the work or money of a company or organization

name: administrative
trans: adj. 管理的，行政的

sentences.english: The job is mainly administrative.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

name: analogous
trans: adj. 类似的；[昆] 同功的；可比拟的

sentences.english: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的海洋建筑技术非常复杂，有些类似于尝试在水下建筑一座桥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似的；[昆] 同功的；可比拟的
detailed_translations.english: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

name: overheads
trans: n. 企业的日常管理费用；杂项开支；一般费用（overhead的复数）

name: initiative
trans: n. 主动权；首创精神
adj. 主动的；自发的；起始的

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

name: checker
trans: n. 检验员；收银员；棋子；方格图案；制止者
vt. 把…画成棋盘形方格图案；使多样化

name: foreman
trans: n. 领班；陪审团主席

sentences.english: There was applause as the foreman of the jury announced the verdict.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团团长宣布裁定结果时响起了一片掌声。

detailed_translations.english: a worker who is in charge of a group of other workers, for example in a factory

name: dividend
trans: n. 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金

sentences.english: The first quarter dividend has been increased by nearly 4 percent.
sentences.chinese: 第一季度的股息增加了近4％。

detailed_translations.chinese: 红利；股息；[数] 被除数；奖金
detailed_translations.english: a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people with  share s  in the company

name: unduly
trans: adv. 过度地；不适当地；不正当地

sentences.english: It didn’t trouble me unduly.
sentences.chinese: 这事并没有让我太烦恼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过度地；不适当地；不正当地
detailed_translations.english: more than is normal or reasonable

name: likelihood
trans: n. 可能性，可能

sentences.english: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

name: infant
trans: n. 婴儿；幼儿；未成年人
adj. 婴儿的；幼稚的；初期的；未成年的

sentences.english: An infant’s skin is very sensitive.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的皮肤非常敏感。

sentences.english: infant formula milk
sentences.chinese: 婴(幼)儿配方奶

detailed_translations.english: a baby or very young child
intended for babies or very young children

name: vulnerable
trans: adj. 易受攻击的，易受…的攻击；易受伤害的；有弱点的

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: imperceptible
trans: adj. 感觉不到的；极细微的

sentences.english: Such changes are imperceptible to even the best-trained eye.
sentences.chinese: 这样的变化即使是对最训练有素的人来说也不易察觉。

name: steep
trans: n. 峭壁；浸渍
adj. 陡峭的；不合理的；夸大的；急剧升降的
vt. 泡；浸；使…充满
vi. 泡；沉浸

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

name: ageing
trans: n. 老化；变老，成熟
adj. 变老的，老化的
v. 变老（age的现在分词）

name: odds
trans: n. 几率；胜算；不平等；差别

sentences.english: (= it is likely ) that he will commit the same crime again.
sentences.chinese: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

sentences.english: (= how likely is it ) that they will mess up?
sentences.chinese: 他们失败的可能性有多大？

sentences.english: a new company that has beaten the odds and succeeded (= it was not likely to succeed, but it did )
sentences.chinese: 战胜逆境而取得成功的一家新公司

detailed_translations.english: how likely it is that something will or will not happen

name: virtual
trans: adj. [计] 虚拟的；实质上的，事实上的（但未在名义上或正式获承认）

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: robust
trans: adj. 强健的；健康的；粗野的；粗鲁的

sentences.english: a robust man of six feet four
sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

detailed_translations.english: a robust person is strong and healthy

name: organism
trans: n. 有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: thermodynamics
trans: n. 热力学

sentences.english: But we know thermodynamics is all about equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 但我们知道热力学都是关于平衡的。

sentences.english: And we went through that and saw what the thermodynamics worked out to be.
sentences.chinese: 我们算出了他们,并看到了它们的热力学应该是怎样的。

sentences.english: And so we can immediately start in deriving all of the thermodynamics, right?
sentences.chinese: 这样我们可以马上开始,得到所有热力学的量对吧？

detailed_translations.english: the science that deals with the relationship between heat and other forms of energy

name: moot
trans: adj. 无实际意义的；未决议的
vt. 提出…供讨论
n. 大会；辩论会；假设案件

name: run-down
trans: n. 刺杀出局；总结
adj. 破败的；衰弱的

name: friction
trans: n. 摩擦，[力] 摩擦力

sentences.english: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查绳索，因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

detailed_translations.english: when one surface rubs against another

name: contamination
trans: n. 污染，玷污；污染物

sentences.english: However, contamination can occur at any point along the food chain, from field to table.
sentences.chinese: 然而，污染沿着食物链可能在任何的点上发生，从田地到餐桌。

sentences.english: There is no evidence of contamination in our lab, and we have controlled for that all along.
sentences.chinese: 我们的实验室不存在污染，在整个实验过程中我们都控制的很好。

sentences.english: Others have said that all of Mars should be protected as a wildlife preserve where we do everything possible to avoid contamination; on the assumption Martian microbes could exist.
sentences.chinese: 假设火星上可能存在微生物，其他人就认为火星应该是我们做任何事来避免污染的野生动物保护区那样来被保护着。

name: sanitation
trans: n. [医] 环境卫生；卫生设备；下水道设施

sentences.english: Overcrowding and poor sanitation are common problems in prisons.
sentences.chinese: 过度拥挤和卫生状况差是监狱里的普遍问题。

detailed_translations.english: the protection of public health by removing and treating waste, dirty water etc

name: sewage
trans: n. 污水；下水道；污物

sentences.english: Chlorine is used in sewage treatment.
sentences.chinese: 氯被用于污水处理。

sentences.english: The factory secretly dumped millions of gallons of raw sewage (= sewage that had not been treated ) into the Ohio river.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂偷偷地把几百万加仑未经处理的污水排放进了俄亥俄河。

detailed_translations.english: the mixture of waste from the human body and used water, that is carried away from houses by pipes under the ground

name: leakage
trans: n. 泄漏；渗漏物；漏出量

sentences.english: a leakage of toxic waste into the sea
sentences.chinese: 有毒废物的泄漏入海

sentences.english: Check bottles for leakage before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前应检查瓶子是否渗漏。

detailed_translations.english: when gas, water etc leaks in or out, or the amount of it that has leaked

name: intermittent
trans: adj. 间歇的；断断续续的；间歇性

sentences.english: The weather forecast is for sun, with intermittent showers.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报为晴，有阵雨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 间歇的；断断续续的；间歇性
detailed_translations.english: stopping and starting often and for short periods

name: carbonated
trans: adj. 碳化的，碳酸的；含二氧化碳的

name: acidic
trans: adj. 酸的，酸性的；产生酸的

sentences.english: Some fruit juices taste a bit acidic.
sentences.chinese: 有些果汁味道略酸。

detailed_translations.english: very sour

name: alcohol
trans: n. 酒精，乙醇

sentences.english: I don’t drink alcohol anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不再喝酒了。

sentences.english: alcohol abuse
sentences.chinese: 酗酒

sentences.english: people with alcohol problems
sentences.chinese: 有酗酒问题的人

detailed_translations.english: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

name: disinfectant
trans: n. 消毒剂
adj. 消毒的

sentences.english: Alcohol may be a medical disinfectant,but should not be relied upon to sterilize water.
sentences.chinese: 酒精可能是医学上的消毒剂，但决不可用来消毒饮用水。

sentences.english: After washing their hands thoroughly, visitors walk through a pool of disinfectant and then into the plant itself.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，把手仔细洗过一遍之后，访客要穿过一个消毒池，最后进入厂房。

sentences.english: Cow dung is traditionally used as a fuel and disinfectant in villages, while cow urine and dung are often consumed in rituals to "purify" those on the bottom rungs of the Hindu caste system.
sentences.chinese: 在农村，牛粪是传统燃料和消毒剂，而牛尿和牛粪往往用在“净化”仪式上，目的是“净化”那些处于印度教等级制度最底层的教徒们。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or a cleaning product that destroys  bacteria

name: sterilize
trans: vt. 消毒，杀菌；使成不毛；使绝育；使不起作用

sentences.english: Sterilize the bottles with boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 用沸水把这些瓶子消毒。

sentences.english: sterilized milk
sentences.chinese: 消过毒的牛奶

sentences.english: sterilizing solution
sentences.chinese: 消毒溶液

detailed_translations.chinese: 使不结果实；使绝育；使无效；杀菌
detailed_translations.english: to make something completely clean by killing any  bacteria  in it

name: ethanol
trans: n. [有化] 乙醇，[有化] 酒精

sentences.english: But the significance of the quarrel goes well beyond ethanol.
sentences.chinese: 但是这场争论的意义远远不止于乙醇问题。

sentences.english: No cars in Brazil run on pure gasoline anymore. The government requires that all vehicles run on blended fuel of about one-quarter ethanol.
sentences.chinese: 如今巴西不再使用单纯靠汽油驱动的汽车，政府要求所有机动车均采用含四分之一乙醇的混合燃料。

sentences.english: This includes construction of 15 ethanol plants with assistance from Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 这包括在巴西的帮助下建设15个乙醇生产厂。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 乙醇，[有化] 酒精
detailed_translations.english: the type of alcohol in alcoholic drinks, which can also be used as a fuel for cars

name: bactericidal
trans: adj. 杀菌的

name: negligible
trans: adj. 微不足道的，可以忽略的

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too slight or unimportant to have any effect

name: methylated
trans: adj. 甲基化的

name: inclement
trans: adj. 险恶的；气候严酷的；狂风暴雨的

sentences.english: Confrontation between the two sides ensued for 3 hours as a result, eventually with the Vietnamese Navy retreating due to inclement weather.
sentences.chinese: 双方的对抗持续了3小时，最终越南海军由于险恶的天气而撤退。

sentences.english: This space wraps around the southern side of the house, and is covered by an overhanging roof. A fireplace allows residents to enjoy the outdoors, even in inclement weather.
sentences.chinese: 这部分空间包裹着建筑的南面，被悬挑屋顶覆盖。即使在恶劣的天气情况下，壁炉的存在使居民可以更享受户外空间。

detailed_translations.english: inclement weather is unpleasantly cold, wet etc

name: insularity

detailed_translations.english: Exclusively is used to refer to situations or activities that involve only the thing or things mentioned, and nothing else

name: cosmopolitan

sentences.chinese: 一个充满活力的国际性都市

sentences.chinese: 一家有着国际化氛围的、热闹的宾馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界性的；世界主义的，四海一家的

sentences.chinese: 加州正在与各州竞争，以求在不断扩大的通讯市场上获得份额。

sentences.chinese: 选举产生的市政府

sentences.chinese: 流动劳工

name: mortgage
trans: vt. 抵押
n. 抵押
房屋抵押贷款

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: pension
trans: n. 退休金，抚恤金；津贴；膳宿费
vt. 发给养老金或抚恤金

sentences.english: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
sentences.chinese: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？

sentences.english: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是自由职业者，应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。

sentences.english: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。

sentences.english: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
sentences.chinese: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill
to grant a pension to

name: priority
trans: n. 优先；优先权；[数] 优先次序；优先考虑的事

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

sentences.chinese: 两用沙发

a car with a soft roof that you can fold back or remove

sentences.chinese: 儿童票价标在成人票价旁边。

sentences.english: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。
